meanings.definition: To move with short, quick movements
meanings.sent1: The rabbit will squail away when it hears a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: I saw the squirrel squail across the yard in search of nuts.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse tried to squail through the maze of obstacles.
meanings.sent4: The leaves squail in the wind, dancing across the ground.
meanings.sent5: The children giggled as they watched the bugs squail around the garden.

meanings.sent1: The squail darted into its burrow at the first sign of danger.
meanings.sent2: The forest is home to many squails scurrying about.
meanings.sent3: The squail froze in fear as the predator approached.
meanings.sent4: The squail's heart raced as it tried to escape the looming threat.
meanings.sent5: The squail's tiny feet pattered softly on the forest floor as it ran.

meanings.definition: To utter a short, sharp cry or sound
meanings.sent1: The bird will squail loudly to warn others of danger.
meanings.sent2: The cat will squail when it is hungry and wants attention.
meanings.sent3: The baby will squail in delight when tickled.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the branches squail as it blew through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The old door would squail loudly whenever it was opened.
